snippet: Nechemya Weberman, an unlicensed ultra-Orthodox Jewish counselor, was convicted of repeatedly sexually abusing a girl in his care.
abstract: Nechemya Weberman, unlicensed counselor in Brooklyn's ultra-Orthodox Jewish community, is convicted of repeatedly sexually abusing a girl in his care; verdict topples wall of secrecy within group, and is seen as significant milestone for Brooklyn district attorney Charles J Hynes, whose office had been criticized for not acting aggressively enough against sexual abusers in insular enclaves of ultra-Orthodox Jews.
lead_paragraph: Nechemya Weberman, an unlicensed ultra-Orthodox Jewish counselor, was convicted of repeatedly sexually abusing a girl in his care.

headline.seo: Nechemya Weberman Found Guilty of Sexually Abusing Girl He Counseled
headline.main: Abuse Verdict Topples a Hasidic Wall of Secrecy
headline.print_headline: Abuse Verdict Topples a Hasidic Wall of Secrecy
